title: Drawing, Door and Over Door, Blue (South) Drawing Room, 1815–22
title_raw: Door and Over Door, Blue (South) Drawing Room
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and watercolor on white wove paper, silhouetted
provenance: 1948: acquired by Museum (from Mrs. K. Gregory)
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane
description:
Vertical rectangle. Design for the Royal Pavilion, Brighton. Design for a section of a wall, with double-doors bearing painted panels of lattice-work design. The over door consists of a painted scene with Chinese figures and landscape, enclosed in a frame and set against a representation of crossed swords. Cornice with a painted border of lattice-work design.

Original album associated with this collection still exists.  See 1948-40-1 accessory

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Door and Over Door, Blue (South) Drawing Room, 1815–22. Pen and black ink, brush and watercolor on white wove paper, silhouetted. 
Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane. 1948-40-59
